docs.snippet: COPENHAGEN, April 21.--A telegram from Lisbon to the United Steamship Company announces the safety of the crew and passengers of the steamer Danmark. The good tidings reached Lisbon from the Azores....
docs.lead_paragraph: COPENHAGEN, April 21.--A telegram from Lisbon to the United Steamship Company announces the safety of the crew and passengers of the steamer Danmark. The good tidings reached Lisbon from the Azores.

headline.main: THE LONG SUSPENSE ENDED; PASSENGERS AND CREW OF THE DANMARK SAFE. RESCUED AND TAKEN TO AZORES--ARRIVAL OF THE MISSOURI WITH SOME OF THE PASSENGERS.

docs.snippet: The mystery surrounding the disappearance of seven hundred or more persons on board the steamship Danmark, whose deserted hulk was seen in midocean on April 8, remains as deep as it was when the news of the disaster first reached this city....
docs.abstract: Danmark's Wreck Sighted by City of Chester; Probable Loss of 700 Lives
docs.lead_paragraph: The mystery surrounding the disappearance of seven hundred or more persons on board the steamship Danmark, whose deserted hulk was seen in midocean on April 8, remains as deep as it was when the news of the disaster first reached this city.

headline.main: THE DANMARK MYSTERY.; STILL NO NEWS OF PASSENGERS OR CREW.THE AGENTS OF THE LINE TO WHICH THE ABANDONED SHIP BELONGED BELIEVE THAT NO LIVER WERE LOST.

docs.abstract: Tropic Struck by Ball of Fire
docs.lead_paragraph: Capt. Barber of the steamship Tropic had an interesting tale of the sea to relate yesterday on his arrival from Progreso. The experience of his vessel had been a most vivid one, full of pictureque incident as well as unpleasant features. The Tropic left Progreso March 31, and passed Cape Hatteras April 6 at 4 in ...

headline.main: STRUCK BY A BALL OF FIRE.; REMARKABLE EXPERIENCE OF THE STEAMSHIP TROPIC.

docs.snippet: Disaster to naval vessels during times of peace having not been uncommon during the past 20 years, it may be truly said indeed that such vessels have suffered far more from the ravages of the elements than from hostile demonstrations proceeding fr...
docs.lead_paragraph: Disaster to naval vessels during times of peace having not been uncommon during the past 20 years, it may be truly said indeed that such vessels have suffered far more from the ravages of the elements than from hostile demonstrations proceeding from enemies in war.

headline.main: ILL LUCK OF WAR SHIPS.; LONG LIST OF VESSELS THAT HAVE SUCCUMBED TO THE ELEMENTS.

docs.snippet: PHILADELPHIA, March 22.--The German ship J.W. Wendt, which left Bremen for New-York on Feb. 21 with a general cargo, is ashore three miles north of Barnegat, and will prove a total loss. The stranded ship is one of the largest sailing craft afloat...
docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA, March 22.--The German ship J.W. Wendt, which left Bremen for New-York on Feb. 21 with a general cargo, is ashore three miles north of Barnegat, and will prove a total loss. The stranded ship is one of the largest sailing craft afloat under the German flag.

headline.main: WRECKED NEAR BARNEGAT.; THE CREW OF THE J.W. WENDT SAVED BUT THE SHIP A TOTAL LOSS.

docs.snippet: ROCHESTER, N.Y., Dec. 24. James Fry, a young man who was traveling as an agent of a New-Orleans mercantile house, took passage for that city at St. Louis on Oct. 26, 1869, on the steamer Stonewall....
docs.lead_paragraph: ROCHESTER, N.Y., Dec. 24. James Fry, a young man who was traveling as an agent of a New-Orleans mercantile house, took passage for that city at St. Louis on Oct. 26, 1869, on the steamer Stonewall.

headline.main: SAVING HIS FUTURE WIFE; THE SEQUEL TO A TERRIBLE STEAMBOAT DISASTER.THE BURNING OF THE STONEWALL TEN YEARS AGO A NEW-ORLEANS SALESMAN'S BRAVERY FINDING AND MARRYING, A YEAR AGO, THE WOMAN WHOSE LIFE HE SAVED AN INCIDENT OF THE FIRE.

docs.snippet: Capt. Christien Pedersen, of the Norwegian bark Plimsall, which arrived from Copenhagen yesterday, reports rescusing the crew of a sinking Italian bark on Nov. 9, in latitude 37 55' and longitude 23 23'....
docs.lead_paragraph: Capt. Christien Pedersen, of the Norwegian bark Plimsall, which arrived from Copenhagen yesterday, reports rescusing the crew of a sinking Italian bark on Nov. 9, in latitude 37 55' and longitude 23 23'.

headline.main: SAVED FROM A SINKING BARK; A NORWEGIAN VESSEL'S OF SHIPWRECKED ITALIANS.

docs.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO, April 20. A dispatch from Astoria, Oregon, says the Great Republic is ashore there and going to pieces. No lives have been lost. The passengers have all been taken to Astoria....
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, April 20. A dispatch from Astoria, Oregon, says the Great Republic is ashore there and going to pieces. No lives have been lost. The passengers have all been taken to Astoria.

headline.main: A WRECK ON THE OREGON COAST.; THE GREAT REPUBLIC GOES TO PIECES ALL THE PASSENGERS SAVED TEN OF THE SHIP'S COMPANY DROWNED.
ASHORE NEAR OCEAN BEACH.; FEARS FOR THE SAFETY OF THE BARK HOMEWARD BOUND--STRIPPING HER OF SPARS, &C.
